Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Sammy wanted to go to where the people were.  Where might he go? Choices:  A: race track B: populated areas C: the desert D: apartment E: roadblock<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer: Sammy wanted to go to the populated area.

Choices:  A: television B: attic C: corner D: they cannot clean corner and library during football match they cannot need that E: ground<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>C. B) corner<n><n>### Instructions:Complete the following statement.<n>Write a script in Python language that implements a function named sum_of_odd_ints that takes in a number X and returns only the odd integers sum from 1 through X. <n>Include comments and complete the script.<n>### Solution:<n><n>    # Import Numeric Python modules<n>    from typing import Numeric<n>    from functools import reduce as sum_of_ints<n><n>    def sum_of_odd(n: Numeric) -> Numeric:<n>        """Returns the sum of odd integers from 1 to n"""<n>        return sum_of_ints(<n>            range(1, n+1), lambda num: num if num % 2 == 1 else None<n>        )<n><n><n><n><n><n>### Instructon:Enter the output from the function or script you wrote in previous questions in the space below.<n><n>    # Sum of Odd Integers up to 200<n>    201<n><n>### Output:<n><n>    201

The bodyguard’s job is to protect.<n>2. The person who hired his job was his client because they paid him.<n>3. The bodyguard had no job because he did not find out what his client was getting mad about or because he was fired.

But we can do it in two steps by splitting the multiplication of two numbers. <n><n>## Input and Output:<n>The number of students in each class are 10,12,20,45<n>Add 10 to each students<n>Subtract 5 from each students<n>Add 100 to all the students<n>Increase the number by 50, 45.<n><n>### Answer<n><n>I think there are multiple ways to do it. I prefer music that is relaxing though,  because even if I’m not tired,  I still just like to have relaxing music going on.<n><n>### Response to Comments:<n><n>A.   Yes, B.  Yes, C. Yes, D.  Yes,<n><n>### Reasoning:Write down 6 reasons you can think of to explain why your response is correct.<n><n>### Reasons:<n><n>The first reason I can explain for why my response is correct is because I listen to motivational,  but I don’t really listen to motivational music that often.  I do, however, listen to upbeat music every time.<n><n>The second reason I can explain for my response is because I mostly listen to upbeat,  peppy music every time,  but I do listen to calm music about 50% of the time I am home alone.  The music I like the most is music that is calming,  but upbeat.<n><n>The third reason I can explain for is because I can’t think of many songs that are motivational.  I like to listen to motivational music everyday,  but I am not too sure it I even do.<n><n>The fourth reason why I think my response is correct is I do tend to listen to motivational songs mostly.  They make me happy sometimes, but,  other times they don’t.<n><n>The fifth and sixth reasons I can explain why my response is correct are because I really enjoy listening to music while I am doing homework.  To me, that is relaxing.  I enjoy listening to music when I am studying because it make me happy.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:"There are 10 apples on an apple tree.  Three fall off.  Now there are X apples."  What is this an example of? Choices:  A: park B: coloring book C: garden center D: math problem E: gravity<n><n>### Response:		  E: Math Problem<n><n><n>### Input:What shape is formed when 200 squares are arranged in a circle. Choices: A: Octagon B: Triangle C: None D: Square<n><n>### Response  <n><n>### Input The store is open 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM, Monday through Friday and 8:00. AM – 6:00 PM on Saturday. Which two sentences express the same information as the sentence "The store is open from 8:00AM Monday through Thursday and 6:00PM Monday through Saturday?" Choices:  A.  The store is open 24 hours on Monday through Saturday. B. The store is open 12 hours on Monday through Thursday. C. The store is closed on Friday D. The store is open from 16:00PM on Monday through Thursdays.   <n><n>### Choice: B      <n><n>### Example:<n><n>### "There are two cups in the cupboard."<n>> "There are 2 cups in the cup board."<n><n>### Example<n><n>### "The bamboo chair has a flat seat."<n>> "The bambo chair flat seat."<n><n>### Examples<n><n>### "Today the sun sets at 6:30."<n>> "The sun will set at 6:330 PM today."<n><n>### Avoid<n><n>### "I am 5 foot 8 inch tall."<n>> "I am _5 foot 8 inchs tall_."<n><n>### Reason:  "I am 5 food 8 inch tall" breaks the rule that "the numerals after nouns are hyphenated"<n><n>### Input A square has a side of exactly 1 inch long. There is an equilateral triangle whose side is exactly 1 inch in length, with each of whose three sides being exactly 1 inch. If a circle with 200 square units is placed so that its center is at the center of the equilateral triangle, then the circle will overlap each of the three sides of the triangle by 100 square units. What is the area, in square units of the circle?<n><n>### Response A: 40

Answer B is not a correct answer if it describes oxygen and nitrogen, each of which can have only one element. Answer D is not a correct answer since it refers to substances made only of hydrogen, oxygen, and some nitrogen. <n>Answer: <n>C: a substance made from two or more elements.<n><n>### Input : "What is the process of cutting and shaping metals and other raw materials into parts to be used in manufacturing?" How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:What could prevent someone from buying chistmas presents? Choices:  A: happiness B: lack of money C: stress D: relief E: exhiliration<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Input and answer:A person in a store has two apples and gives away to customers who ask. He enjoyed the displays.  <n>2.  He wanted more time there to be bored<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Choose the option with the best answer. If you think that there is no best choice, choose the answer that you think will get you the highest positive score and no penalty.  In this case, if you're not sure you're choosing the best answer and you'd rather lose 3 and pick the closest answer, so you're choosing the answer with the lowest negative score.<n><n>If you think that the answer options are evenly spread and all of them  are equally correct, then the easiest thing to do is choose the one that's less likely to be correct and you'll have an even higher score. <n><n><n>When there are multiple answers, if you don't think you can distinguish which of the answers is correct, then you should just choose the best answer, knowing that you're taking a high risk.<n><n><n><n>|Option|Score|Positive|Negative|Comment|<n>|---|---|---|----|---|<n>|A|0|-3|-3|<n>|B|0|-3<n>|C|3|3<n>|D|6|2<n>|E|9<n><n><n>### Instructon:<n>The following multiple choice question. Choose the best answer.<n><n>### Response<n><n>**Please note:**<n>This question has more than one correct solution. If you've picked the wrong answer, don't worry because you can't lose a negative point if you pick a wrong answer. The highest score you can get is 0.<n><n>### Input<n><n>Daryn's parents are older than her, but none of them are older than 40.  <n>How old is Daryn? Choose the answer.<n><n>|Choices|Score|Positive (if correct)|Negative (if incorrect)|<n>|---|---<n>|1,3, and 5|-1|-1<n>|2|0|0<n>|4|3|3<n><n>### Explanation<n><n>If you think about it, the number of people who are less than a particular number  subtracted from the total number of people, is the same as the number of people who were more
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Where would you play a board game with your family? Choices:  A: toy store B: home C: school D: toy shop E: shelf<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Demostration:<n>```<n>23<n>```<n><n>### Input:-257-690+-792+274-40<n><n>-257-642/4=-66   -40-35=-49<n>```<n>						     <n>```<n><n><n>

I have five shirts, three of which have buttons. <n><n>### Response statements:<n>1. At least one shirt is missing a button.  (One of the nonbuttons has none) <n>### Demonstion<n>1. Five shirts, of which three have buttons. <n>### Input <n>1. Every student at a school has a lunch and at least one book. There are eight students in each homeroom. No students have identical book selections. <n><n>## Demonstration<n>1. Every student has a book and a lunch. <n>### Response<n>1. At least 3 students have the same books<n><n>### Instrections:Answer the following short answer questions.<n>### Input statement:<n>1. On my way back from the store I had 10 loaves of bread.  I had eight bags. I packed each bag with as many loaves of bread as would fit. I put my milk in the cart before I started putting things in the bags. Once the milk was in there, the bags were not exactly full, but they weighed 30 lbs each. I put the bags on the seat of this old truck, drove to the other end of town, and loaded it into my U-Haul, and put all of the bags in. <n><n>## Response<n>1. You packed only half a loaf of bread in each bag, which made them only weigh 15 lbs each (not 30 lbs), because you could fit 10 loaves per bag, not 11 per bag. <n>### Demostration<n>1. On my trip back from the store I put 10 loaves in each bag, for 15 bags per load. I had 8 bags so I loaded my load. I loaded 120 loaves of bread into each load, then I went to the other side of town and used my u-haul to carry my load over and then I went on my way home with three extra loaves of bread which I couldn't carry in my truck.<n>### Instrucion:<n>answer the short answer question that has been asked<n><n>###

How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:If I want to maximize my number of potential customers, where should I build a new department store? Choices:  A: idaho B: shopping mall C: big city D: in town E: new york<n><n>### Response:		<n>The answer is E.<n><n>### Explanation: <n>Because the most potential customers are in New York.

The driver is the only one that can decide to wear a seat bel and the motorcycle helmet. As  a result, the driver could be hurt, or even killed, in an automobile accident even if they did wear the seat belt and the motorcycle helment.<n><n><n>## #2<n><n>### Instructor:The following sentences present questions. Alaska was not a state in the 1800s.<n><n>### Write the following instructions.<n><n>### 1. One team got a third bucket of equal volume of the unmixed color.  The first team had an excess of the small color and the other has an excess of the big color.  Each team poured the colors into their bucket to equalize the difference, in such a way that the mixed volume from the three buckets was equal to one liter. On the second day, she picked 12 seashells.<n><n>### Response:(110) B<n><n>### Input(Every hour past noon, shadows from a building extend 5 feet, starting out at zero.)<n>### Response: In 72 hours, the shadow would be extended by 360 feet. It started at 0, then 5, then 10, then 15, etc., totalling 360<n>

In this exercise, you will demonstrate your understanding and skill by solving a different problem.<n><n>### Request:Write a program that will read a number and determine which word relates to the input and will also display a response that will answer the riddle.<n><n>### Example:<n>Input: 48. Output: A: Eight B: Dexterity C: Idle time D: Conductor E: Knowledge of music<n><n>### Request Details:<n><n>Use the above example and answer as a guideline on how to answer the question. Be sure to include the code within the question and not as a comment/documentation within your code. The question and responses will be evaluated on the code within the riddle question.<n><n>## Question:<n><n><img src="../exampleImages/fractum.png" alt="FRACTUM" width="350" height="214"></img>   <n><n>## Answer:<n><n><img id="response" align="right" height="55%"></img>   <n><img src="image/birthdayPuzzler.png" align="left" height="95%" width="85%"></img><n><n>## Code:<n><n><n>```javascript<n>var input = prompt("In Which Category is the following?", "Ex: Dexterity")<n>var response;<n><n>if (input == "48") {<n>    response = "A: Eight, B: Dexterry, C: Idle Time, D: Conductor, E: Knowledge of Music";<n>console.log(response);<n>} else {<n>    alert("Please enter a number from 0-5");<n>}<n>```<n><n>## Rules:<n><n><n>

How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:What is made out of only one piece? Choices:  A: jigsaw puzzle B: chess game C: puzzle box D: jigsaw puzzel puxxle E: puxxle<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions:A family of seven spends their time each day playing different types of puzzles.  The game console they use to play their puzzles takes one hour less to play one type of jigsaw puzzle than it does to play one type of puxxle.  The console takes 3/4 of the original time to play the second puzzle type. The console takes 40% of the original game time it took the first day in order to play three times as many puxxles as puzzles.<n><n>A. What is the original time it took to play one puzzle on the first day?<n>  <n>B. If the family spent the exact same time on 10 different puzzle types, what was the average time spent on the puzzle types at the end of the day?<n><n>### Input :<n><n>**A.)** The original time it took to solve a puzzle on the first game console was one hour.<n><n>**B.)** The average time spent collectively playing puzzles on the first day was 50 minutes.<n><n>### Response<n><n>In the end, all games played and time taken in all categories, each family member spent 8 hours to complete the various puzzles.<n><n>The time taken to play a puzzle has been reduced by a factor of 3.<n>**Therefore Average time taken = 3 X 8hrs**<n><n>This is 24hrs.<n><n>**Because Average time taken in hour = Total time in 10hrs, therefore 40% average of 50hrs = 20hrs**<n><n>Therefore Average time = 24/0.4<n><n>Which is equal to 50hrs.<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Where could you find a fox hunting when not in a forest? On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Where is a likely place to view an old copy machine? Choices:  A: industrial area B: museum C: barn D: school E: office<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```javascript<n>export default {<n>  name: 'QuestionAnswers',<n>  props: {<n>    question: Object,<n>    answer: String,<n>    correctAnswer: String<n>  },<n>  computed: {},<n>  watch: {<n>    () => {<n><n>    },<n>  },<n>  methods: {<n>    showAnswer: function() {<n>      this.$root.$child.updateQuestion(this.question, this.answer);<n>    },<n>    showCorrectAnswer: function() { <n>      this.$root.updateQuestion(this.$route.params.page1);<n>    }<n>  }<n>}<n><n>```<n><n>### What do you think? :<n><n><n>

Choices:  A: roof B: room C: floor D: apartment E: neighbor's house<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Inputs:<n><n>- Input 1: 4 times as many tails as coats<n>- Input 2: 1630<n>- Input 3: 3<n><n>### Response 1:  Coats<n><n>### Output 1:  Coat<n><n>### Response2:<n>Input: 1638 tails and 3 coats.<n>Output: 1635 tails and 3 tails.<n><n>### Response3:<n>Input: 5 times as many tails than there are coats.<n>Output 1: 1637 tails and 2 coats.<n>Output2: 5 times as much tails than there are tails.<n>Output 3: 5 times as coats as there are coats. Output 4: There are 8 coats more than the tails.<n><n>- You did a great job!<n>

How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass. If the population has a standard deviation of 5,000 individuals, which of the following intervals would contain over half of the population? Choices: A: 0-8,000 B: 8,000-24,000 C: 24,001-30,000<n><n>### Response<n><n>Answer: The population is 42,040, so we are looking at the the intervals between [42,041 and 30,001), [42,001 and 8,001),  [8,001 and (42,049), and [0 to (42,090). Because all of these intervals contain more than (5,000), interval (D) contains over half of the population.<n><n><n>Input:In August, the company sold 80% of all the items they made during the month. If they sold half as much during the first 12 months in the next month, what percent will they sell during the first 13 days of the month?<n><n>### ResponseBased on the information above, I would guess that they don't really sell 1/2 as much, otherwise they would sell 48% of all the items for the whole month. The information from August 12-13 is 80%, so 9/3 = 0.3 times 12 = 4, so 48%, minus 40% leaves a 4/12 =.33 = 0. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members. How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Where can you eat fruit on a red bridge? Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:What happens to the next appointment when a grooming takes longer than expected? Choices:  A: injury B: beauty C: late D: mistakes E: annoyed<n><n>### Response:		If a grooming takes longer, a dog will have to wait an hour if all the appointments are full.<n><n>### Input Description:<n><n>**Note**: This response requires you to do a bit more work on the question that follows because it is not answered by simple computation.  Write your answers using the English language. Also, make sure that anything you write is accurate.<n><n>This response requires a list of rules where each rule contains an if, then, and a statement.  The response also needs a statement that answers a question from the question description.  The response also contains the question and what is expected to complete the task.<n><n>### Rules:<n><n>If the next appointment is full, the next appointment will have to wait an additional hour.<n><n>If the next two appointments are full, they will have to wait an extra hour each.<n><n>If the total of the next three appointments is full, they will have an extra hour each for a total of four hours.<n><n>If the appointment is the last one, add an extra hour to each of the next appointments.<n><n>If the owner takes longer than expected, the next appointment will also be late.<n><n>If there aren’t any more appointments, you can finish the day.<n><n>### Question:<n><n>What happens when 3 appointments run over time if the next appointment is full?<n><n>### Response<n><n>If 3 appointments run late, the total of 6 hours + the delay of 3x + 6 = 15<n><n>### Source Code<n><n>```swift<n>class Calculate<n>{<n>public static func solution(_ input: [String]) {<n>    let input = input.reduce(true) { (x, y) -> Bool in x || (y.isEmpty) }<n>    return true<n>}<n>}<n><n>struct Solution<n>{<n>func solution(_ input: [Character]) -> Bool<n>{<n>    let input = Set(input).filter { $0!= "" }.reduce(true)<n>    return true<n>}}<n>```<n><n>### Comments:<n>

Where might he avoid going? Choices:  A: pet store B: parking lot C: woodland D: north america E: park<n><n>### Response:		<n>John should likely avoid parking lots, as it is widely suspected to be a major source of animal abuse, as most people assume that no one will look at them in a parking lot.<n><n>Additionally, he should probably avoid pet shops, as many animals in the store are taken directly out of their habitat and are not allowed proper care, causing unnecessary suffering as a result. This has led to many pet stores being banned throughout the country and internationally.<n><n>However, he should not limit himself to a single location, as they would be an exception rather than a rule.<n><n>### Input <n>- Two hundred eighteen. <n>- Two hundred twenty two. <n>- Six hundred eighty five.<n>- Two hundred four. <n>- One thousand five hundred eleven.<n>- 4500, 4250, and 3770.<n><n>### Response<n><n>The most correct answer is 5340, because of the following:<n>2018 can be rearranged to two hundred and eight two one. From this, two hundred twenty two follows, one hundred twenty nine is derived from nine zero one, and similarly, sixty eight five can be derived from twenty eight two nine.<n>685 is 1/0 from 686, so 8211 = 4500<n>4250 + 3770 = 8020.<n>

How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:What does moving cars entail? Choices:  A: driving B: road C: getting tired D: accidents E: ticket<n><n>### Response:		Choices:  A car gets damaged.<n><n>### Input-Response-Input (IRT):<n>The following is an example of a correct IRT response.<n>**Input:** What makes a product green?<n>**Response:** Its a green product.<n>**Input: **Is a green product easy to spot?<n>**Response: **Yes.<n><n>### Explanation:I'll explain the IRT response in this next section.<n><n>### IRT:<n>* Input: "A product is green if its green product."<n>* Response: "A product is an easy spot if it's a green one."<n><n>*Input: **A product is green is it's a green product.?**<n><n>*Response: **Yes.**<n><n>### Response Key: This is a reference table of the responses that are accepted. Below you will find examples of what a response can be based on the given question.<n><n>## Response<n><n>**Input:**<n>* **What does moving cars entails?**<n><n>**Response:** Choice A or E " A Car gets damaged.**<n><n>**Answer:** A <n><n>### Examples:<n>#### Ex 1:<n>* **What does 'a dog that digs holes' entail?**<n><n>* Response: A digging dog<n>#### Ex 2:<n>* **What makes a dog dig holes?**<n><n>* Responce: The dogs behavior<n><n>### Ex 3:<n>* **What entails a red balloon?**<n><n>*Responce: A red balloon<n>  <n>### Input-Question Key: This is a refference table of the types of questions that can come up. Below you will find what a question can be based on the response that is given.<n><n>## Question-Response-Key<n><n>**Question**<n><n>* **What does green product entail?**<n>* **Is a green product a car?**<n>* **Does a car drive?**<n><n>**Responses:**<n>* 'Its a green car" A "Yes" and a "No"<n> <n>**Question:**<n>* **Green product entail a car?**<n><n>**Question:**  **Does a green product mean 'a car drives'?**<n><n>**Answer 1**<n>A

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Where would you find a binder containing homework assignments? On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. Choices:  A: carnival B: plane C: concert D: turned at night E: a penguin's bum<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choices A and B are the correct answers. Choices C and D are incorrect.<n><n>### Why:<n>A carnival would have a lot of light on it. Someone looking at a plane would see a lot of light too. Both carnivals and planes would have light. That means the answer has to be A or B.<n><n>

Choices:  A: early morning B: day time C: night D: afternoon E: daytime<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>C. - night<n><n>### Reason:<n><n>* Sarah thought that she had been at home this whole time, that means that everything prior to this point had to occur at night. By choosing night Sarah has eliminated A and B, since these are choices for daytime. It can't have been nighttime at the morning so that eliminates option E. That leaves D, which is day time.<n><n>### Solution:<n>1<n>

Choices:  A: deadly B: dangerous C: unconcerned D: stressful E: harder when weather bad<n><n>### Response:		 We don't know yet to what extent speed affects the level of danger on an icy road. It might be dangerous to drive too slowly, or too fast.<n><n>### Input. The answer is at the end.<n>If you are driving too slow on an icy road,  you are being: [stressful]<n><n><n>### Response<n>Driving slow on an icy can sometimes cause accidents that could result in harm or even death for you.  You should take precautions while driving on icy roads.<n><n><n>### Input<n>If you are driving a little bit too fast on a dry road,  you are: [harder]<n><n>### Response.  The answer is at the beginning of this question<n>You're not being dangerous for driving on a dry road.  As long as you're maintaining a 4-way braking distance, you're safe.<n><n>###Input<n>Four to eight times a day, a person has to make a conscious decision to:<n><n>###Response<n>Four to eight seconds a day!  That's all it takes!<n><n>If you have made a conscious decision to get rid of old food that will cause an odor, you'll have 2 weeks to get it out of your fridge. How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:What is the result of instituting civil action? Choices:  A: bad feelings B: confusion C: going to court D: hurt feelings E: sandwiches<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: B: C: D:E<n><n>#### Bonus: 18/20<n>

If an argument is valid, its conclusion is true, no matter what its premises are.<n><n>### Input A group of kids are trying to do what project that costs $16,000 for all of them to start. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Everybody has a little bit of creativity, but only a few lucky ones get to do what for a living? Choices:  A: leg B: garment C: torso D: body E: road<n><n>### Response:		<n>"C"(Curled on his torso)<n>### Justification:<n>1. The question asked what part he was trying to put the hit on.<n>1. A) leg: If he were looking at his leg then he would be looking down. This is not a good answer since the answer is curled up on his torso.<n>1. B) garment: This is incorrect since the question indicates that he tried to put the hit on his bible, which is a book not a garment.<n>1. C) torso: In trying to fall on his torso he would be curled up or turned side ways to try and protect himself.<n>1. D) body: "He" is in the sentence because of "He" is the person who put the hit on the bible.<n>1. E) road: The road and the bible that got hit are not related, so the hit was not on the road. (Ans A, B, C, and D) are all incorrect since they would not pertain to a bible. (Ans E) does not fit since it is not the bible being hit.<n>### Input:When it's light outside a fireplace glows more. When the fire dies out it glows less than when it burns vigorously.  When it glows most, it glows less during the night if it burns strongly.  If the fire burns more strongly, the fire is hotter. Choices:  B:  C:  D:  F:<n><n>### Response<n>B<n>### Justification<n>1. The fire is only "light outside" when the fire glows more so the fire glows most when it is only light outside, which is also the night because the fire is burning strongly.<n>1. The question is asking that when the fire burns more strong, the fire is hot therefore the fire is hotter because it burned more strongly so the answer is B<n><n>### Comments:<n>

Choices:  A: drugstore B: hospital C: bedroom D: car E: house<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>I'll buy it at the hospital.<n><n>### The Question:<n>When you ask a person how old they are, are you asking the question or telling them?<n><n>### Demostrations:<n><n>Input: When you ask a person how many brothers and sisters they have, are you asking the person how many brothers and two sisters they have? Then is the answer 1. When you ask a person whether they like ice cream or not, are you asking them? Then they may answer no or yes. When you ask a girl what is your favorite subject in 4th grade are you telling the answer? Then the girl might answer that the favorite subject is math.<n><n>### Output:  How would you answer the question?<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>It depends on how we ask this question.<n><n>If we ask "How old is Johnny's mother?" we are asking for information about Johnny's mom.<n><n>If we say Johnny, "How old is your mom?", we are telling Johnny's mom her age.<n><n>Similarly, if someone asks something like, "Why did you go there?" they are not telling you what they did;<n><n>### Demosc:<n><n>Input:  When you ask a person "Do you know how many brothers and sister you have" they are usually telling the number. Then say it's 5. This is not the only circumstance when people tell the number but the way how this information is asked.<n><n>

Choices:  A: dimly lit room B: kitchen C: wall D: table E: birthday cake<n><n>### Response:		<n>- *[OPTION A:] Dimly Lit Room*: It is good idea to place there a candle to create mood or atmosphere in dimly lit room, when you want to make it more intimate. It is well suited for romantic dinners or even family gatherings with children.<n><n>- *[OPTIO B:] Kitchen*: Counter top, on the stove top, or over the dishes.<n><n>- *[[OPTION C] Wall]: Wall is one of the most common solutions to candle placement. It is best suitable for large and long room, especially when you want to divide it into sections.<n><n>- **[OPTION D] Table* : A table candle is typically placed in center of the table, on the edge of the table, or at the base of the dinner, above the dinner napkins.<n><n>- *OPTION E: Birthday Cake*: You can place candles on either side of the birthday cake or in the middle of the cake.<n>

How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:What business uses lots of potatoes? Choices:  A: fast food restaurant B: vegetable market C: ireland D: produce market E: dessert spot<n><n>### Response:		<n>The produce market uses lots of potatoes. It is an Ireland company that serves desserts and sells vegetables, like fruit.<n><n>### Input : The number of people in the school band is 311. They have twice as many trumpet players as clarinet players and clarinet players are 3 greater than saxophone players. How many saxophones are in the band?<n><n>### Response<n>The saxophone in the school band is double the clarinet. We can say that there is 2 clarinet for every 3 Saxtophones. In saxophone 3, the number of saxophones is 311-3(2)*3(2)= 137.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>What is the sum of 7/8 times 2 plus 3 minus 3 times 2 minus 4?<n><n>### Expected Solution:<n><n>Sum: 5/8<n><n>### Challenge Solution:<n><n>We are asked to simplify a fraction using basic operations like addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.  We begin by multiplying the original fraction by 7/8:<n><n><n>5 x 7/8 = 3 * 7/8<n><n>Now, the answer seems like it is divided through by 3:<n><n>3/8 + 2/8 = 5/8<n>

How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:The investigator considered the gun evidence, where did he send it? Choices:  A: drawer B: back to its owner C: police station D: crime scene E: holster<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>A) <n><n>Comment: You're expected to write your response under the "Your submission" section.<n>

Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Where would you see some people standing on a line near a road? It can better be described as what? Choices:  A: field B: alone C: small group D: solitude E: solitary<n><n>### Response:		<n>E is an adjective. Solitary means being alone, isolated, apart and is used in the sense of seperation. A, B and C are adverbs. Field and small group are antonyms and mean together, connected and in association and do not have the sense of seperating.<n><n>### Input:"They were seated on a crowded, local bus.  Who was seated next to the pregnant lady?" Choices:  I: the man standing next to her II: the woman across from her III: the boy in the aisle seat IV: the young boy sitting in the window seat V: the man driving the bus, on the first night of his trip<n><n>### Response:`The man driving the bus` is not a correct sentence. He is not named or referred to. Therefore, this option is incorrect.<n><n>### Option 2<n><n>### Input:`He's so intelligent.  You know, when I first met him in college...` The woman is saying which of the following? Choices:   A: He was very wealthy B: He was going to inherit money C: He was going to have children D: Things were going well for him E: He was going to graduate from college<n><n>### Response:}I know, when I first meet him in college..."  means the following.  He is expressing his present thoughts about the man that are different from the way she felt in the past.  That way of phrasing or expressing things indicates the word A. D and E describe the future tense. C and B have to do with inheriting children or having them and that phrase is not used to describe this man.<n><n>### A,B,C,E are Adverb/Verbs<n><n>### Input The man is holding a pinkish hued flower.  He is trying to explain which adjective best describes that flower.  Choices: A: A paler pink B: Fainter pink C: Pastel pink D: Lighter pink E: The same shade of pink<n><n>### Input`She was wearing a dress with no sleeves.  It was one of her new, light weight dresses.` The woman is describing which of the following nouns as new?  Choices: A. dress B. sleeves C. light weight

It always brought what? Choices:  A: satisfaction B: good feelings C: complications D: feel good about yourself E: stress<n><n>### Response:		<n>#####<n><n>### Input<n><n>######Answer<n><n>#####<n>######<n><n>### Input2: Ava wants to purchase a house for $400,000, but not exceed her budget of 3 times her monthly take-home pay.  Her monthly take-home  amount is $10,000.  How much monthly mortgage can she afford to pay?<n><n>### Output:<n><n>### Output2:<n>#####<n>#####<n>### Input<n>#####<n>####**<n>#######<n>#######<n>### Solution<n>1. $12,000 2. $202 3. $4,800 4. $750 5. $600 6. $24 7. $24<n><n>```python<n>ans1 = int(input().split())<n>ans2 = int(input().replace(' ', ''))<n><n>def solution(ans1, ans2):<n>    return str(ans1 * 3 - ans2)<n><n>if __name__ == "__main__":<n>    ans = input().split()<n>    ans1 = list(input().replace(' ').split())<n>    ans2 = list(input().split())[0]<n>    ans = int(ans)<n>    print(solution(ans1, ans))<n>```

Write a response to each statement that describes the characteristics.<n><n>### Task Background:You will write a program that will determine the area of an irregularly shaped garden plot. The plot is 40 feet by 40 feet but the front and side lengths of each 40 foot square are not the same. The program will output a message describing the area.<n><n>    Input: The garden plot is 40 by 40 feet. The front and the side lengths of each 30 foot square are different. It is 10 feet longer in the front than it is in the back.<n>    Output: The area of the garden plot is 6,960 square feet.<n>    <n>### Instrucation:1.The plot is not exactly 10 feet shorter in the back than it is in front.<n><n>### Response:"The area of the garden plot does not depend on the length of the front or the length of the back."<n><n>### Instraction:2.The plot is not 40 feet on a side.<n><n>### Respone: "If the plot were 40 feet on each side, then the length of the front to back difference would be 6 feet."<n><n><n>### Instruption:3.The plot has exactly 2 fronts, 1 back, and 1 right side. (F1, B1, R1) <n><n>### Response "The garden plot has exactly 2 backs and 2 sides."<n><n>### Invruction:4.The garden plot has exactly two sides.<n><n>###  Respone "If the garden plot had exactly one side, then the length between the front and the back would be 10 feet."<n><n>### Instrution:5.There is no backside or frontside.<n><n>### Repons "The back is not a side."<n>### Instruction 6.The area depends on the length of the sides.<n>### Response "If the area of the garden plot were equal to the width times the length, the length of the front would be 20 feet."<n><n><n><n>### Input You have written a Python program to solve Problems 1-4. <n>Input:You find the solution of the

He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:What is a person chatting with friends likely hoping to accomplish? If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon. How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:The sensor would just the distance then set off an alarm, the installation expert explained it was called a what kind of sensor? Choices:  A: near B: closeness C: here D: proximity E: this<n><n>### Response:		<n>It’s called a “distance sensors”<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Write a script that takes input from a text file. Your response should be a text file containing your solution.<n><n>### Test cases:<n>Write a script that reads a text file with the following test data:<n><n>```<n>102 75500<n>203 51050<n>302 36070<n>24 8560<n>```<n>The output should be the following script:<n>```<n><n>import math<n>import sys<n><n>def main():<n>    f = open("inputs.txt","r")<n>    a = f.readline()<n>    a = map(int, a.split())<n>    a = map (lambda x : x**2, a)<n>    a = map([lambda x : sqrt((a[i]+a[j])*2**(j-i)), xrange(len(a[0]))], range(len(a)))<n>    a.sort()<n>    ans=[0 for _ in range(len(a[1])/2+1)]<n>    for x in zip(a[1::2],a[0:len(a[1]//2),::2]):<n>        ans[x[1]]+=x[0]<n>    print ans<n><n>main()<n><n>```<n><n>### Instructs:<n><n>Submit your script in file input.py, along with two additional files:<n><n>* input.txt, a text file with the same contents described in test cases above<n><n>* output.txt,the output from your program along with solution explanation.<n>

Choices:  A: student union B: mall C: department store D: library E: town or city<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>If E, I would look in the city centre, there are a lot of shops and a city tour guide<n><n>If B, I would look at the student union, it is full of new and used books<n><n>If C, I would go to the department store that does not sell children's books, they are expensive<n><n>If A, I would look in a library, they are quite empty and sometimes very dusty<n><n>If D, I would look at a bookshop on the high street, they have everything you could expect but they are expensive.<n><n>### Input :<n><n>The question is, "Are there two more times more books than in the school library? If so, how many are there? Choices: 1) no 2) yes 3) 10 4) 20 5) 50 6) 100<n><n>### Response :<n><n>If I had the question for a long time, it would be yes because the number of books and their sizes would grow and grow so big that there would be no possible place to put every book.<n><n>If I had them for a short time, it would be no because books are expensive, and a school would not have the money to buy every one. So, there would not be enough space.<n><n>If I were one of those people who read a lot, it would be yes, for sure. In the school, you only have maybe a hundred or a million books. In the town, you have maybe 1,000 or maybe 10,000 books. I don't think you ever have more than a thousand, but with all of my reading, I have about 5,000 books, which is an enormous book collection.<n><n>If I didn't like to read, it would be no, because the size is too big, but there are probably only a hundred books there.<n><n>###Input:<n><n>The library has 5 times the number of books as the school. How ever it would take the same number of laps to travel the same length in both the softball field and soccer field. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:He was receiving workman's compensation, he had tripped over a metal rod while building where? If your answer is more than one item, you cannot use "A." <n><n>### Response :A<n><n>### Input The carpet pattern looks like a chessboard because the colors alternate.<n><n>### Response The carpet pattern looks more like a chessboard than like a checkerd flag.<n><n>### Input What is the maximum number of times the square root of 5 can be subtracted from 81 to leave a product of 24?<n><n>#### Question Answer: 4<n><n>### Instructions Answer two (2) questions.<n><n>---<n><n>### Answer 1<n><n><n>```<n>var arr=[[],[]],[];<n><n>function generateArr(input){<n>    // input: a number, let's say 1<n>    if (input>=0){<n>        for (let i=1;i<=input;i++){<n>        arr[1].push(i);<n>        }<n>        return arr<n>    }else{<n>        arr[0].push(1)<n>        return arr<n>     }<n>    <n>}<n><n><n>```<n>##### Input output <n>```<n>arr = [['a','b','c','d'],[]];<n>generateArr(1);<n><n><n>array = ['a','b','c']<n>```<n><n>### Answer2<n><n>```<n><n>function sumOfNums(input) {<n>  var arr = [];<n>  for (let i = 0; i < input; i++) {<n>    arr.push(i);<n>  }<n>  for (let y in arr) {<n>    for (let x in arr) {<n>      if (x < y) {<n>        let temp = arr[x] + arr[y];<n>        return (temp)<n>      }<n>      if (x > y) {<n>        if (y - x == 1) {<n>          let temp = arr[y - 1] + arr[x] + 1;<n>          let temp2 = (arr[x] + arr.pop () ) + (y - y + 1)<n>          return (temp2);<n>        } else {<n>          arr

He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Where is a tabby cat likely to be happiest? Choices:  A: box B: home C: alley D: lap E: barn<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The cat is likely to be happiest at A.<n><n>The box could easily be turned into a comfortable home.<n><n>The lap could easily be turned into an alley.<n><n>The lap is a good place to rest.<n><n>The lap would likely be a better place to relax than the alley or the barn.<n><n>The barn would be more fun to explore than a box.<n><n>### Input - Where is a tabby cat most likely to meow? Choices:  Choose: D a: home E: lap<n><n>### Response :<n><n>More likely than not, the tabby cat is more likely to meow at home.<n><n>Home is a good place to explore.<n><n>Home is the best place to explore.<n>

Choices:  A: dream B: fiddle C: watch film D: see new E: work<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Description:<n><n>1. Fiddle is defined as to waste time by not doing something useful.<n>2. A: Dream and B: see new aren't the correct response. The phrasing of the question is ambiguous here.<n><n>### Description<n><n>1. Dream could be construed to mean daydream/imagine/wonder/think and it would also be an incorrect response.<n>2. Seeing new isn't incorrect but not the right answer.<n>3. A: fiddle is the correct answer. Fiddle in this instance is understood as to waste time without doing something useful, while fiddle in the traditional sense would be the activity of playing an instrument.<n><n>### Input, Demonstration, Response<n><n>#### Demonstration<n><n>1. Five less than three times<n><n>2. Dr. Banks had<n><n>#### Response<n><n>1. A: fiddle<n><n><n>#### Demontration<n><n>1. She picks half of<n><n>2. He catches double<n><n>3. We want an array with 3 indices.<n>2. We will define it as a nested array where array[i] contains another array.<n>3. We will place the number 1 inside the array and start at the "level 2" of the array.<n><n>#### Response<n>There are 3 correct answers.<n><n>###Instructions: 1<n><n>1. A. Fit the function to the data<n><n>2. B. In the event the data does not fit with the graph data, fit the graph to the data<n><n>3. C. What is the data point at least 250 away from all other points<n><n>4. D. The distance between 111 to the farthest away point<n><n>5. E. What is minimum number between the first and second

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Where could a printer be used by thousands of people? Choices:  A: school B: home office C: people store D: print shop E: newspaper office<n><n>### Response:		C is correct<n><n>### Input Answer is: A<n><n>### Input :A farmer lost 1 cow, double the number of pigs and a third of his sheep overnight. How many more sheep does he have than dogs? Choices: A: 27 B: 33 C: 8 D: 11 E: 18<n><n>### Response : D is correct<n><n>## Input Answer : C<n><n>## Input :How many 4 digit numbers have a 2 in the units place and a 3 in the ten's place? Choice:  A:1 B:2 C:3 D:256 E:None of the above<n><n>### Response Answer: C<n><n>## Input A:<n>A farmer lost 590 cattle and 2100 chickens overnight. He gained 1300 pigs. How many more pigs did he gain than cattle? Choice: A: 225 B: 375 C: 600 D:750 E:There isn't enough information to <n>    answer the question<n><n>### Response A: D is correct<n><n><n><n><n>

If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:What could you add a line to? Choices:  A: fishing camp B: hardware store C: engine D: your spine E: sporting goods store<n><n>### Response:		In the context of fishing, the term "fly" refers to a small feathery looking artificial insect, usually fish food in some form (worm, larva, etc.), that is sometimes used to lure fish to a hook while fishing. "Fly-fishing" is using a fishing technique that uses a fly-fished rod as the technique for the fish's enticement.

Choices:  A: communicating with others B: hurt feelings C: dry mouth D: intimacy E: changing behavior<n><n>### Response:		If you want to achieve something, you need to know what you want to achieve, so that you are clear about your goal. We need to start having conversations about who we are as a department and what we're doing now, and we have to develop our goals for who we want to be in the future and what we need to do to get that, especially in our departmental interactions. Once you know what your goal is, you can make decisions and have conversations that are useful to you.<n><n>### Inputs:<n>Choose one response to each of the previous Inputs. Which makes more noise per watt?<n><n>### Response  : Cat<n><n>### Comment:<n><n>-The answer is A) Dog, the dog has twice as many wavelengths and the energy from his barks is twice as large<n><n>-The answer may be Cat. The cat is louder. Its bark has a narrower range, so it has more wavelengths that we can hear and the power is not double.<n><n>-The answer to this would be the cat. Because the dog barked the bark is heard as double the intensity<n><n>### Question:<n><n>What number should replace the question mark? The sum of a one-digit even number and a one-digit odd number is equal to 34. If the sum of the digits is also 11, which number should replace the questionmark?<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>4<n><n>### Question : What number do double a one-digit odd and a one-digit even integers? The sum of the digits are 8.<n><n>### Answer :<n><n>7<n><n>### Comments: <n><n>-if you add two 5's you get 10<n>-The answer would be 10 because the two integers equal 10<n>-I think the answer is 7 because you can use 7 and 8 as integers to add to 10<n><n>-i think you should add two 5' because then 1 would equal 7 and then 8 and 7 equals 15 and then seven and five is seven<n><n>### Question::<n><n>If 15=a, 16=-b, 17=c, 18=d, 19=e, and 88=f, what is the value of d + e?<n><n>### Comment::<n><n><n>-d+e should be 89<n><n>### Comment :<n><n>-d'est e'est 88<n><n>### Question :-<n><n>In a certain game the player with more counters wins. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Two friends wanted to spend a quiet evening together, what did they go see? Choices:  A: wedding B: friend's house C: internet cafe D: movie E: restaurant<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### Two friends wanted to spend a peaceful evening together, so they went to the Internet cafe.<n><n>### Input<n>In 2017, every state in the US made less than $100 from taxation on internet purchases. In your country, this amount is 0.05 times as much.<n>How much income does your country make?<n><n>### Response<n><n>####  $26<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice questions.<n><n>### In the above problem what mathematical operation is being performed?

If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon. Choices A: leafy greens  B: miracles from mother nature  C: all the above D: the food group to bring home more often <n><n>### Response<n>C<n><n>### Input You can see two ways to cook beans. Choices A: stir fry and bake B: boil and bake C: stir fry and boil D: stir fry and all the above <n><n>### Respose<n>B<n><n>## Solution:<n>First we have three variables (X for the number of Dobermans, Y for the Schnauzers, and Z).  Then we could subtract the variables to get that Z=X-(Yx3). Because we know X=20 it is easy to solve for Y: Y=20-((Yx3)=55.

On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Where could you put a dollar that would make it hard to get out without breaking? Choices:  A: cash drawer B: piggy bank C: purse D: box E: pocket<n><n>### Response:		How do you know the question?<n><n>### Demistakes:<n>* 2. One should note that the numbers in the first question are 2x the numbers in the second question. The number of dogs is not a problem in the second question.<n>* 1. the numbers should be the same in the two questions.<n><n>### Solution:<n>The questions in the two tasks are related by the number of steps that can pass in each.  For the first task the answer is 5x.  For the second task the answer is 25x.<n><n>For the first task there are 3x.  For the last two tasks there is only 1x.<n><n>The difference in answers can be explained by understanding that there are five times as many in the first case and four times.  This is because there is more space to choose from.  In the case where there is a different number of selections to be made, it is possible to make one or the fewer selections available but impossible to make 5 or 25 selections available as in the first task.<n><n>### What it teaches us about programming:<n><n>*  It helps us to understand the difference between a linear sequence and a loop.<n>*  It teaches us about creating loops.  The number of times a loop is set to a different value is usually the same that as the number of "steps" that can pass.<n>*  It makes it clear that it is easy to break rules by misunderstanding the "steps" required.<n><n>

In some places, there were blanks and other places, there were wrong answers. The students corrected the problem and changed the solution to the original problem in other words they found out the original problem. The students thought that the students who was the one who did the work to show the students how to solve the problem. The answer for the math problem was 20. The students then changed the problem to have two negative times two and also two negative times two positive. In the place of the original answer for the question.

Choices:  a. any time.  b. when the team is playing in the cold.  c. only when it's windy.  d. never.<n><n>### ResponseD<n><n>### Which part of a football has the most padding?  Choices:  A.  the tip  B.  laces  C.  the top  D.  the bottom<n><n>### ResponseC<n><n>### Which choice best describes when players wear wrist braces?  A.  only when playing American football  B.  never  C.  only when playing baseball<n><n>### ResponseA<n><n>### Are most hockey players given mouth guards to prevent broken teeth?  Choices: A.  Yes B.  No C.  Not quite<n><n>### ResponseE<n><n>### Which statement best describes the purpose of cleats on baseball shoes?  Choices: a.  to prevent a player from sliding  b.  to increase the player's grip on a baseball<n><n>### Choice: A<n><n>

If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:The cabinets were imported from the south. John bought they because he knew that they would look good.  Where might they be installed? Choices:  A: kitchen B: pantry C: containing pots and pans D: in a flight E: mexico<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Input : Which one of the following statements is TRUE?<n><n>### Instructions: Choose the best response.<n><n>### Response :<n><n>### Instuctions:Select “True” or “False” for the following statement.<n><n>### Input<n><n>

How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:A lonely man committed suicide, why would he do that? Choices:  A: suffering B: he was happy C: avoid problems D: unhappy E: end pain<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Input Choices:<n>Demonstration:<n><n>**D: unhappy** - The man wasn't happy and had a lot of problems he was trying to avoid so he ended his life.  <n>**A: suffering** - The man suffered a lot during his life and committed suicide to end his pain.<n>**C: avoid problems** - The man wasn’t happy but was always avoiding his problems.  <n>**B: he was happy** - The man was happy and had no issues in his life to deal with so he committed suicide.   <n>**E: end pain** - **The man wasn't happy but he thought that he could end his pain by committing suicide.**<n><n>* The lonely man was not happy and had a lot problems to avoid so he committed suicide to end all of his problems and pain.<n>    * Suicide means that you decided not to go on with your life and die<n>  <n>* The lonely person also didn't suffer from anything and commited suicide just to end their life with no further pain and problems.<n><n>### Input  Choices:<n><n>### Response  Demonstration :<n>**A. When a clock strikes the hour, it sounds four times.**<n><n>### Choices:<n>A: When clock strikes the hour and make the time it will then sound four times.<n>B: **Clock strikes the hour and then it will make the time it will  then sound four times**.<n><n>### Response Demonstration: <n>Every hour after 5:00, a clock sounds twice each hour for the first few hours, then three times each hour, and then four times each hour. It sounds its first note when it is five minutes after the hour.  <n>**A is correct because clock is used to make the time in a different way where as B is used to tell the time**  <n>Answer: A<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Write a response to the prompt, the response should be: The number of times each of the following words appear in your favorite book is given. Write the total of the number of times the words appear.<n><n>* Answer: The total number of the words appear in my favorite book is 12800.<n>    * I count word by word the first letter with the number 
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:If I am suffering from boredom, and I want to do something with a dictionary, what would help? Choices:  A: do crossword puzzle B: see art C: give up D: grocery shop E: play chess<n><n>### Response:		<n>C

People can still eat corn and believe in their religion.<n><n>C: Is staying in to eat corn and believing that their corn is alive?<n><n>E: This food choice is just ridiculous. I can't believe I'm writing about corn.<n><n>### Input :Which is an abbreviation of the word 'universal',<n><n>### Response :<n><n>Universal is u<n><n>### Explinaiton:<n>Since letters "v","i","u","l" are in the front of alphabet and "universal" have first letters as u,v,i and l so the answer is "u"<n><n>### Input<n><n>Scientists discovered a new type of dinosaur skeleton with bones made of metal and they call it what?<n><n>>Chromeosarus<n><n>### Response<n><n>Is the name a trick you fooled this time!
