I thought it would be fun.<n>> [Discuss:](https://github.com/mrsantanapeter/React-Project-3-1/issues) Did you have any issues? if so please include them here. Thank you!<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Where do fish spend the majority of their time? Choices:  A: body of water B: lake superior C: underwater D: toilet E: aquarium<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Input :How many gallons of milk are there in 4023 bottles of milk?<n><n>### Response :33<n><n>### Input  :Farmer Jones lost 28 chickens in a recent rainstorm. She currently has 88 fewer chickens than she had before.  How many chickens did she have before the storm?<n><n>### Answer  :56<n><n>### Input   :Norman lost his job at the library. He had 54 pounds of books with him, which he decided to mail off to Grandpa. If he mailed off 25% more than he had originally and mailed an extra pound of books to his sister, how many pounds of books could he spare to give to a friend?<n><n>### Input    :On Tuesday, Lilly woke up with $5.20 in her wallet. On Wednesday, she spent an even number of dollars to buy a bike from her babysitter. On Friday, she earned an even number of dollars in allowance, spent an amount more than twice that of Wednesday, and saved equal amount that she spent on Tuesday. How much is she left with in her wallet?<n><n>### Output :$1.80<n><n>### Inpuy  :Tom went out to run some errands. While he drove, he ate 12 hot dogs, all of which were sausages. How many plain hot dogs are left if he ate five plain hotdogs for every sausage one?<n><n>### Respomse  :-14<n><n><n>### Input :- How many times as many as 50 cents does 90 cents equal?<n>### Demonstation:50 x 2 = 100 cents<n>### Input:- A snake is twice as long as two times as tall. How tall is the snake?<n>### Demosttion:- 2 x 4 = 8 inches<n>### Input:- At his first birthday party, Mike got 14 candles on his cake.  Four times more candles than he got on his birthday last year.  How many more candles did he receive?<n>### Demoistation:20 + 4 = 2

Choices:  A: wait for B: eat out C: entertain D: please parents E: paint<n><n>### Response:		She had a deep love for all of her friends and every Friday she had an inevitable open invitation for them. Choice c.<n><n>### Input<n>What does the statement _x is greater than half of y_ mean? Choices: A: The number x is greater than the half of the number y B: x is the same as half of y the  c: x is less than half of y<n><n>### Response<n>x is greater than half means that x is greater than.5 or half of the number y<n><n>### Input/Question<n>The number of apples sold in a fruit display was increased by 15% and reduced by 4%. Calculate the increase or decrease when x = 650 and t = 98.<n><n>### Response/Answer<n>The increase of the oranges in the display when t=98 is 15%<n>The decrease when t=98 of oranges in the display is equal to 4%<n><n>Let y= the increase/decrease<n>y= 0.15 (650)= (100+ 75)<n>y= 0,15 (100)= 15<n><n>Let x= the original number of oranges sold which was 650<n>x= 100<n><n>y= 0 (75)<n>y=-25<n><n>The increase or decrease of the original number of apples when t=98 which was 65 is 25<n><n>

Choose the response below that is the best strategy.<n><n>One person works on Task 1 and 3, and the other person works on Task 2 and 4.<n><n>**Two people work on Task 1 and Task 2**<n><n>**The second person works on 4**<n><n>**One person works on Tasks 1 and 2, and two people (not including the first person) work together on 3.**<n><n>**Six people work on Tasks 1, 2, 3, and 4.**<n><n>### Response"Two people work on Tasks and 2. Write a request.<n><n>## Request: Make ten in a row on the dice board.<n><n>### Response<n><n>#### Instructions:Answer the following problem-solving question.<n><n>## Example:Joe and Jerry went to the basketball game at school.  At halftime between the 1st and 2nd quarters, they saw a student in shorts playing basketball with a ball that they recognized as Joe's basketball.  However, Jerry thought he had lost the basketball several weeks prior, and it was the last time Jerry saw it.  How is this possible?<n><n>### Problem-Solving Instructions:Write a response that answers the question.<n><n>## The correct answer is:Jerry threw Joe's basketball out of the basketball hoop after the game but lost it again, making him think he lost it. Joe recovered and replaced the basketball because he didn't know it was lost the second time around.<n>

It is important that you provide as much context around your answer as possible.<n><n>### InputA<n><n>Input: How many integers (of any size) can be generated from the digits 2, 3, and 4 that don’t contain repeated digits?<n>(For example, the sequence 231423, 314423, 231443, and 231432 are allowed. The sequence 444444 is not allowed.)<n><n>Answer:<n>2<n><n>Output:<n><n>Ans = 2<n><n>Explanation:<n><n>If we take the digits 2,3, and 4 then we can generate the sequence 23,34,24 and 234.<n>Hence Ans = 4<n><n>Ans2 = 2;<n><n>Explanation2:<n><n>If we add one digit to each sequence we get 24, 43, and 42.<n>Hence Ans2 = 4<n><n>### Instraction:Answer the following multiple question.<n><n>## Input:<n><n>Input: Four is twice as many as two. How many fewer are there than there are of the two?<n><n>Answer 1: 2<n><n>Exaplination:<n><n>In the four is twice as many as twice and how many fewer are there than twice.<n><n>So ans = 2<n><n>Input4: <n><n>Input: Four more than twice five more in ten fewer than 8<n><n>Answer 4: 15<n><n>Exaplinatio:<n><n>4 more than twice five more is = 12 more than twice<n><n>12 + 10 = 22<n><n>Answer 6: 6<n>

Choices:  A: fresh fruit B: wine press C: fruit basket D: fruit cocktail E: picnic basket<n><n>### Response:		The answer is Choice A, the fruit is used for a fresh fruit salad.<n><n>### Why?<n>```<n>What does one chop use a grape for?  There are many answers but the correct one is B, the wine press<n>```<n><n>How can we help?<n>```<n>There are multiple ways to help me write the answer.<n>Give examples of the ways<n>```<n><n>### Demand:We need to know the number of cars with 3  or less wheels that were made in the state of California. This question can be solved in two steps, a simple step and a more complex step. Write the simple step first and the complex step second.<n><n>Simple step example:<n>1. Add up all the numbers that are 3 less than a given number.<n>2. Subtract the numbers of all the even numbers that remain.<n><n>Complex step example:<n>1) Write the number of cars with zero wheels that were made.<n>2) Divide that number by the number that have two wheels.<n>3) The quotient is the number that has 2 as a remainder.<n>4) Increase the quotient by zero, 5 times.<n><n>### Responses:<n>```<n>A: The simple step (example) will tell us the answer. We can get there by making a table.<n>```<n><n>```<n>	| |	| |	|<n>	| 1	| 2	| 3	| 4	| 5	|<n>	| |		| |	|	<n>1	3		|	|	|<n>2	6		|	|      1<n>3	9		|	|<n>4	12	|	|<n>5	15	|<n>				<n>B: In the complex step (example) we can make a table and solve for the first three numbers<n>```<n><n>```	| |	|   | | 4 = 1 | 4<n>---	| |	---	|	--<n>5  | 5	  |   |<n>4	  | 4	 |   |<n>3	  | 3	 |   |<n>2  | 2	  |   |	<n>1	  | 1	  |   |   |<n>|	0  |
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:James was a student who had a report that is due tomorrow.  Where might he spend most of his time today? Choices:  A: university B: college class C: class room D: classroom E: library<n><n>### Response:		Choice: A

Choices:  A: entertainment B: neat C: happy D: intoxicating E: illegal<n><n>### Response:		 A<n><n>### Explanation:  The correct answer choice is [A], having your marijuana in different bags helps to keep it from being intoxicating to the people who see it. This isn't necessarily illegal since in some cases the use of marijuana for medicinal purposes is legal.<n><n><n>### Instructions:Below are 3-4 statements that are factual in nature and have a logical flow. There are also 2-3 statements that are illogical in nature and lack a logical flow.  Write a response that appropriateness completes the request. <n><n>In the example below, the instructions are given by example:<n><n>### Instructor: 1/5 students were in-between when asked whether or not they were between in terms of height last year.  This year, 2/5 students are in-between in terms of height.  What fraction of these students were in-between last year? <n><n>### Democrat: The students that were in-between last school year, but that were not in-between this school year, make up 10% of the total number of students last school year.<n><n>### Response B:  This is illogical. In the statement, students that were not in- between last year are in-between last year. This is confusing and not what is being asked.  <n><n>### Democracy: This year there had been an increase of the number of students that were considered to be in-between by 100.  There are 5 times as many students that are in-between this year, than there were ten years ago.  This is a logical statement.<n><n>### Democratic:  <n><n>### Democratic Response:  This answer is illogical as it is missing an important factor. It should mention that half of the students were counted as not being in between both years, not just this year. Hence, the response is 15% and not 10%<n><n><n>### Responses:<n>Write a response B that adds to an instruction.<n><n>### Examples:<n>Instruction 1:  Input: The teacher had a class full of children that she split into groups of 2,3, 4. The girls in the group are twice the number of boys in the group. She had two groups with fewer students than

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Why would a company be going public? How much do you have to pay in British pounds to pay 20 in American dollars?<n>Answer: $60<n><n>2. How much do you need to pay in American dollars to pay for 20 in British pounds?<n>Answer: $100<n><n>3. Similarly, the city should be followed by 'train station' or 'train station', with no space between the words 'train station' and the end of that line. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:The keys were black and white, what were they attached to? Choices:  A: front pocket B: cabinet C: purse D: chain E: piano<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: The keys were attached to a piano. <n>

Dr. Banks gave away 53 in January, which accounts for the first 6 weeks in a month.<n>3. Next month, 36 more toothbrushs were given out than the toothbrushs in January.<n>4. Dr. Banks then gave away 67 more than there was in the month before.<n>5. In March 46 were given out.<n>6. How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:The window across the street was broken and John felt guilty. He never meant to damage what? Choices:  A: friend's house B: curtains C: space shuttle D: front door E: classroom<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Output<n><n>John felt guilty. He never felt that way before he accidentally damaged his friend's house.<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>#### Grammar<n>>The "I never" construction indicates that John did not use to damage windows until he broke his friend's house windows.<n>"He never meant" followed by an infinitive "to damage" suggests that John's intention was not to damage any windows.<n><n>>John felt guilty because he accidentally damaged the windows.<n><n>### Input<n><n>A.The window across the street would have been broken and John felt guilty if he never meant to damage a friend's house. Choices:  A, B, C, D, or E<n><n>### Response<n><n>A<n><n>### Output <n><n>John felt guilty if he never damaged a friend's house because he accidentally broke the window across the street.<n><n>### Grammar<n><n>"John would have felt guilty" indicates he did not feel guilty, because when he accidentally bent a window at a friend's house, he would have felt guilty if he meant to do damage to a friend's house and had not.<n>" John felt guilty that he accidentally broke the windows." suggests that John realized he did not intend to.<n><n>### Other grammar explanations<n><n>The use of "if I ever" indicates that John has never damaged a window and never felt bad about it. He does not feel bad; he is just saying that he would have felt bad if he ever damaged a window.<n><n>### Output:<n><n>John felt guilty because he broke the friend's window. <n><n>

A car driving to the left of the police man had a tire problem causing the driver to swerve the car. The police man turned his back on the accident to the policemen was pointing to a street.<n>### This is the situation<n>>The police man is waving a car in the street. (directing traffic)<n><n>### I should do this<n>When the police man turns his back to the accident, the car swerved<n><n>But he doesn't want to turn around because he wants the cars to keep driving<n><n>So what does he do?<n><n>So the police man should do this<n>The police man should book the driver<n><n>### Why did he do it?<n>The police man thinks it was the car that is guilty of making the car wobble.<n><n>So the police book the driver of the car.<n><n>The police man points to the street, and waves on the car to make the driver keep going.<n><n>The accident happened because the car was going to the left, and it wobbled the car.<n><n>That was why the car swerved.<n><n>So, the police man has booked the driver.<n><n>### He turned to face the accident, and points to the street to keep on driving<n><n>The police man has directed the car to turn right to go to the street.<n><n>### After 24 hours the police man let the driver of the car go, because the driver is honest.<n><n>###<n>### The driver made a u-turn to get help from an ambulance and call his parents.<n>###<n>When the police man saw that, he let the car move in<n><n>Because the driver knew that it was him who has done this. (the driver turn right)<n><n>Because in less than 24 hours, the car will continue driving after the problem is fixed.<n><n>

Choices: A: sing B: eat more food C: cough D: run<n><n>### Response<n><n>A<n><n>Explanation: When a person has a sore throat, he or she will sing. That way, if their singing voice is bad the singer will know this first, not their audience, so they can try their best to sing well.<n><n>### Response Explanation:<n>Explanation: The man in the illustration is 20 meters tall, so his shadow is 10 meters long. When the man casts his shadow across his building, it is 10 meters wide, so his building is 25 meters long. If it is 6 hours past noontime, then the man is standing on the 6-hour line and his shadow is 30 meters long, so the man’s building is 50 meters long, and if it is a cloudless day, the man is standing on a corner on the 18-hour line and his castle is 11 meters long, so his castle is 29 meters long.<n><n>Explanation 2: We can use addition to add two fractions and obtain a percentage increase.<n><n>### Answer explanation 2<n>Explanation: If the number of Dobertan pupils is 20, then the number of Schnuzers is 30.<n>

How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Where is disease often spread but shouldn't be? Choices:  A: ghost town B: third world country C: human body D: rug E: hospital<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>

In your response, make sure you identify the source that you are quoting.<n><n>### Research:<n>In August, 2009, 16 children were treated for lead poisoning. One school district in Illinois closed all of its water fountains due to lead contamination.  What was the rate of lead poisoning in the school district?<n><n>### Response<n>The children were treated for the lead poisoning so that would indicate that the children were exposed at some point.<n><n>To find if the water fountains in the school district were contributing to the lead poisoning of the children in the school district there are multiple methods and tools. First there could be interviews with the school board and a survey could be conducted to determine if the school fountains were contributing to the high levels of lead poisoning among this group.<n><n>There are also other options for determining if the school district fountains were the source of the lead poisoning. Using chemical tests such as lead testing kits or chemical analysis of water samples could be used to determine if there in high amounts of lead in the water from the school fountains.<n><n>##### Answers:<n>1. The method that a primary researcher used to collect information related to water fountains contributing to lead poison in children is interviews.<n>    1. Interviews are a good way to collect information because they provide an opportunity to ask clarifying questions. <n><n>### Evaluation<n>In your opinion, what questions and issues should the student review before completing this section and then submitting this part of the assignment?

Choices:  A: two feet B: two ears C: horns D: lay eggs E: one head<n><n>### Response:		What do all humans (except for those who chose A or B) have on the side of the head? (Answer: E.)  I only chose A and B, because I am not a human.<n><n>### Input<n><n>```<n>Which two animals have gills and live in water?<n>Choices:<n>A: a dolphin and a catfish<n>B: a lion and a dog<n>C: a bull and an elephant<n>D: a frog and a salmon<n>E: a lizard and a turtle<n>```<n><n>### Response<n><n>```<n>A and B are the only animals that live in water with gills. They must breathe with gills, and the gills are only visible while they are young. They must live underwater until they are old enough to survive in air, since gills are only in water.<n>```<n><n>## See also<n><n>* Easter Egg<n>* Hidden Message<n>* Hidden Object<n>* Hidden Page<n>* Hidden Words (game)<n>* Ouija Board<n>* Password<n>* Secret Key<n>* Secret Message<n>* Transparent Turtle<n>* Two-syllable word<n><n>## Further reading<n><n>* Bunn, B. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:What has highly criticized security? Choices:  A: university B: concert C: home D: terminal E: airport<n><n>### Response:		I chose choice E: terminal.<n><n>### Justification:<n>A terminal has highly criticized security as one may witness a terrorist attack in it as seen in the incident of September 11th, 2001.<n><n>### Question:What does the term 'Turing machine' mean?<n><n>### Response 1: I chose 'A Universal Machine' as to my understanding it is a Universal machine. It is what we use to solve an arbitrary complex problem.<n><n>### Response2: It is the only machine that does not require an input, but could only count.<n><n>### The response would be of type:<n><n>Answer: A Universal Machine<n><n>### Justifications:<n><n>A Universal Machine is more than one problem to solve:<n><n>In every program P for a Turing machine, every run is deterministic. There is always a string S such that P(S) terminates, and the computation for S never halts.<n><n>This statement is often restated to say that every program is always either correct or never halts.<n>Universal machine is the Turing machine that reads the input in sequence and processes each character. Turing Machine is basically an algorithm that works on an infinite string of symbols using a single-taped Turing Machine. It has infinite states, symbol table, and read/write heads. The head of the Turing Machine can move left or right on the tape infinitely many times. The universal machine can read the input in sequence and compute all the algorithms that can be computed by a Turing Machine.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:What should the bean bag chair sit on? Choices:  A: house B: den C: family room D: wood E: floor<n><n>### Response:		Input:What should the beanbagchair sit on? Choices : A: house B: Den C: Family room D: Wood E: Floor, Response: C<n><n>## Test case: Input:5  Choices:1,0,5<n>Output:1<n><n>## Test case 2:Input:24.6Choices:0,5,10,15,20,25<n>Output:25<n>```<n><n>## Implement: The code below can be copied and pasted.<n><n>```bash<n>#!/bin/sh<n><n>questionCount=$1<n>if [ $# -ne 1 ]; <n>then<n>	echo "Usage: $0 input "<n>else<n>	questionCount=$1<n>	input=$2<n>	answers=($3${#4:-${#4}})<n>	if [ $# -eq $questionCount ];<n>	then<n>		echo $answers[choosenIndex]<n>	else<n>		echo "This isn't correct, please try again."<n>	fi<n>```<n><n>## Output<n><n>The output below can be copied and cut and pasted into a txt file.<n><n>### Output: 21:4:0:6:3:7:11:64:130:0:0:100:10182:0:0:0<n>```bash<n>#! /bin/sh<n><n>echo $1<n>if [ $1 -eq 21 ]<n>then<n>	#echo $2 $3 $4 $5 $6 $7 $8 $9 #9<n>	for (( i=0; i<9; i=2)); do<n>		for(( i=0; i<= ${answers[$i]}  ; i++  )); do<n>			echo $answ[i]<n>		done<n>		for (( j=10; $j<=${answers[$i]} ; j++ )); do<n>	    	echo $answ[$j]<n>	  	done<n>	  	echo $answ${i+2}<n>	done<n>else<n>	echo "Not correct"<n>fi<n>```<n><n>

Write a response based on the prompt that follows:<n><n>The NFL, like other sports leagues, generates income for its members, but it also uses that income for advertising and promotional purposes. These activities are not funded by admission fees or ticket prices.<n>The primary purpose of a nonprofit organization is to provide social services not to generate revenue.<n>The difference in the accounting policies of these two organizations is obvious.<n><n>One organization is a nonprofit public service corporation that does not directly generate revenue. It also does not report any revenue at all. The other organization uses its nonprofit status to generate revenue for its members. This revenue exceeds $11 billion annually.<n><n>### Response<n><n>#### What makes it fair or unfair?<n><n>The NFL and NFLPA are different in two fundamental ways: their purposes and their policies. The NFL does not provide public services for low-income citizens. In that respect, the NBA does not resemble the NFL. The NBA can provide a public service, but it does not make use of its nonprofit status.<n><n>NBA revenue is mostly derived from broadcast rights and advertising. The NBA's broadcasting contracts are estimated to be worth about $2.5 billion annually. The NBA has a number of corporate sponsors but its sponsorship deals are relatively modest. It appears that the NBA's television ratings are low compared to the NFL. That is a major drawback for the NBA from a revenue perspective. The NBA faces a higher level
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:Who designs a building? Choices:  A: builders B: driver C: architect D: fall down E: tradesmen<n><n>### Response:

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Five less than three times the number of Doberman puppies plus the difference between the number of Doberman puppies and the number of Schnauzers is equal to 90. If the number of Doberman puppies is 20, how many Schnauzers are there?<n>Answer: 55<n><n>Input: Dr. Banks had 330 toothbrushes to give away to his patients. He gave away 53 toothbrushes in January. He gave away 67 toothbrushes in February. In March he gave away 46 toothbrushes. In April and May, he gave away the remaining toothbrushes, half each month.  How many more toothbrushes did Dr. Banks give out in the busiest month versus the slowest month?<n>Answer: 36<n><n>Input: Sally picks 30 seashells on Monday. On Tuesday, she picks half as many seashells as she did on Monday. If she can sell each seashell for $1.20, how much money can she make if she sells all of her seashells?<n>Answer: 54<n><n>Input: Jordan and Perry took a boat out to the lake to go fishing on a Monday morning. Jordan caught 4 fish and Perry caught double what Jordan caught. On the way back to shore, the boat tipped over and they lost one-fourth of their total catch. How many fish remain?<n>Answer: 9<n><n>Input: Every hour past noon shadows from a building stretch an extra 5 feet, starting at zero at noon.  How long are the shadows from the building 6 hours past noon in inches?<n>Answer: 360<n><n>Input: The marching band has 110 members.  There are 4 times as many percussion players as there are woodwind, and twice as many woodwinds as brass.  How many brass players are there?<n>Answer: 10<n><n>### Input:A person who wants to make more at their job but can't will often need to find a what? Choices:  A: own house B: better job C: win lottery D: save money E: feel safe<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer: save money<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Input: The person needs save money<n>Output: Option B, D<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write an expression that performs the task for the given input.<n><n>### Example Input:<n>One person has two quarters, two dimes, three nickels, and 4 pennies, all of which are in good condition. What is the total value of all this money?<n><n>### Example Output:<n>$.34<n><n>### Example Instructions:<n>The expression you write should not use any variables.<n>If the person has more than one of each type of coin, count the number of coins of each type first and add the coin values together. Then you will need to convert the dollar amount to cents as pennies are worth a penny per piece.<n><n>### Additional Notes<n><n>To avoid the possibility of division by zero, no coins will be exchanged for coins of a higher value.<n><n>### Reasoning<n><n>This task is more difficult, however, the output and example instructions provides the necessary information to complete the task and ensure accuracy.<n><n>Reaching for the calculator, your teammate has found the answer:<n><n>```<n><n>   2 quarters    2 dimes 3 nickels 4 pennies<n>    (0.25) + (0.10) + (0.05) + (0) <n>   .34<n>```<n><n>However, your teammate has failed to follow the task's requirement to not use variables. In this task, the user is counting coins, so each variable has a single name.<n><n>```<n><n> .34<n>```

Answer A would be in an airplane.<n><n>### Input:(Nurse at the hospital).  Which patient in Ward 4 would you want to care for?<n><n>### Response:(Nurse at hospital).  There are three people here.  My priority is the person with the most serious condition.<n><n>### Exponation:<n>The three people on the ward probably have different levels of ailment.  The person with the most serious disease should be cared for immediately so as to avoid further injury.
